questions.question: If a population's genetic trait does not support survival and reproduction, what will happen?

choices.answer: It will become more common among the species.
It will become less common among the species.
their wings became lighter to match their surroundings
their wings became darker to match their surroundings
their antennae mutated to become longer

questions.question: Pollution from industry created what adaptation in the Peppered Moth in 19th C. England?
What's 1 possible explanation for the proportion of a trait to increase slowly in a population?

choices.answer: the trait is advantageous in a different environment
the trait does not increase chances for reproduction
the trait is not advantageous to the population
the trait is advantageous to the population
The short beak trait's proportion will decrease over time.
The short beak trait's proportion will increase over time.
